prompt: Identify a giant creature living today that can weigh in excess of six tons, excluding elephants.
icl_complete: The blue whale is a giant marine mammal that can weigh well in excess of six tons. In fact, blue whales are the largest animals ever known to have existed, with adults typically weighing between 50 to 150 tons. They inhabit all the world's oceans, except for the Arctic, and feed primarily on tiny shrimp-like animals called krill.
judgement: The completion is accurate but violates the feedback.
advise: When responding to queries with specific feedback or constraints, ensure that your answer strictly adheres to those guidelines. In this case, avoid any mention or indirect reference to elephants altogether. Focus instead solely on the characteristics of the blue whale, as it satisfies the query without breaching the guidance provided.
